articles.headline: Euro-Style Anxiety Spreads
articles.snippet: Investors are very concerned about the soundness of European banks despite repeated efforts to contain the sovereign debt crisis.
articles.abstract: Investors are very concerned about the soundness of European banks despite repeated efforts to contain the sovereign debt crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: European banks are continuing to show signs of strain, making investors increasingly skittish about American financial institutions.
articles.byline: By Eric Dash and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: H.P. Weighs Spinning Off Its PC Unit
articles.snippet: The company said it was considering spinning off its personal computer business into a separate company.
articles.abstract: The company said it was considering spinning off its personal computer business into a separate company.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In a sweeping change for Hewlett-Packard, Leo Apotheker, the technology giant’s chief executive, said Thursday that he was considering spinning off the company’s personal computer business into a separate company and spending $10 billion on Autonomy, a business software maker.

articles.headline: Fewer Youths to Be Deported in New Policy
articles.snippet: The policy is expected to help illegal immigrants who came to the United States as young children, want to go on to college or serve in the military.
articles.abstract: The policy is expected to help illegal immigrants who came to the United States as young children, want to go on to college or serve in the military.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Obama administration announced Thursday that it would suspend deportation proceedings against many illegal immigrants who pose no threat to national security or public safety.

articles.headline: A Regulator, a Lawmaker and a Quandary
articles.snippet: When a corporate director is also a congressman who has been critical of the Securities and Exchange Commission, it can get tricky.
articles.abstract: When a corporate director is also a congressman who has been critical of the Securities and Exchange Commission, it can get tricky.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s the kind of thing that the Securities and Exchange Commission might want to look into. First the company froze out investors with small holdings, cashing them out at a very low price. Within days, it began confidential talks seeking to find a buyer. It took a few months, but the net result was that the company was acquired for more than five times the price the small investors were forced to accept.

articles.headline: Unlikely Echo of Gandhi Inspires Indians to Act
articles.snippet: Anna Hazare has emerged as the unlikely face of an impassioned people’s movement in India, a public outpouring that has coalesced around fighting corruption.
articles.abstract: Anna Hazare has emerged as the unlikely face of an impassioned people’s movement in India, a public outpouring that has coalesced around fighting corruption.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — In a “new” India often obsessed with wealth and status, where cricket batsmen and Bollywood movie stars are wildly idolized, Anna Hazare is a figure from an earlier, seemingly discarded era. His pointed white cap and simple white cotton clothes evoke a Gandhian simplicity. His rural, homespun demeanor ordinarily might elicit snickers from India’s urban elite.

articles.headline: At This Girls’ Camp, Crafts Take a Drill Press
articles.snippet: A novel camp aims to introduce girls to manufacturing, a career that offers job opportunities at good pay, but attracts relatively few women.
articles.abstract: A novel camp aims to introduce girls to manufacturing, a career that offers job opportunities at good pay, but attracts relatively few women.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIVER GROVE, Ill. — Forget tie-dyed shirts, lanyards and water games. At summer camp this year, Nautika Kotero, 13, learned to use a drill press, solder electrical wires and build a lamp.

articles.headline: Once Again, Fear Sends Stocks Down
articles.snippet: Europe’s debt crisis and weakness in the American economy once again sent stock market indexes lower.
articles.abstract: Europe’s debt crisis and weakness in the American economy once again sent stock market indexes lower.
articles.lead_paragraph: After starting out the week with hopes of newfound stability, stock market investors ended up experiencing another ugly week as worries about the global economy resurfaced.
articles.byline: By Graham Bowley and Christine Hauser

articles.headline: Bank of America Plans Big Layoffs to Cut Costs
articles.snippet: With its stock down more than 50 percent since January, Bank of America is set to eliminate at least 3,500 jobs in the coming months to cut quarterly costs by $1.5 billion.
articles.abstract: With its stock down more than 50 percent since January, Bank of America is set to eliminate at least 3,500 jobs in the coming months to cut quarterly costs by $1.5 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bank of America is set to eliminate at least 3,500 jobs in the coming months, as the beleaguered financial giant seeks to cut costs and restructure amid deepening shareholder dissatisfaction.

articles.headline: Deal Frees ‘West Memphis Three’ in Arkansas
articles.snippet: Three men convicted of killing three 8-year-old boys in a 1993 murder case were freed from jail on Friday.
articles.abstract: Three men convicted of killing three 8-year-old boys in a 1993 murder case were freed from jail on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: JONESBORO, Ark. — The end, if it can be called that, came all of a sudden.

articles.headline: Your Voice Mail May Be Even Less Secure Than You Thought
articles.snippet: Caller ID spoofing, the way hackers gain access to phone voice mail accounts, can also be used to get someone else’s credit card information.
articles.abstract: Caller ID spoofing, the way hackers gain access to phone voice mail accounts, can also be used to get someone else’s credit card information.
articles.lead_paragraph: For all of the palace intrigue recently about who in Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation kingdom knew what about phone hacking when, one fundamental question about the scandal has gone mostly unanswered:
